cell.html: A ruthless, violent, and somewhat Scarface -esque drug lord from South America who the doctors become entangled with during season one. Has a thing for 1980s music and ultimately blackmailed Sean and Christian into giving him a new face so he could leave the drug business behind and start again. Instead, Sean and Christian gave him the face of another wanted criminal and he was arrested at the airport while attempting to flee the country. Appeared briefly in a dream in the season 2 finale, encouraging Sean to kill the Carver. He also appeared in season 4 as a hallucination of Sean's, encouraging him to repeat his sexual exploits with a young babysitter. Apparently has taken on the symbolic role of Sean's inner voice for aggressive behavior. Later, Escobar convinces Christian and Sean to restore his original face. He then breaks out of security while in the clinic, and kills his accomplice to remove a threat to Sean and Christian. It is revealed later in the season that James has been working for him. In the fourth season finale, he is killed by his wife, Gala Gallardo. (deceased)
cell.text: A ruthless, violent, and somewhat Scarface -esque drug lord from South America who the doctors become entangled with during season one. Has a thing for 1980s music and ultimately blackmailed Sean and Christian into giving him a new face so he could leave the drug business behind and start again. Instead, Sean and Christian gave him the face of another wanted criminal and he was arrested at the airport while attempting to flee the country. Appeared briefly in a dream in the season 2 finale, encouraging Sean to kill the Carver. He also appeared in season 4 as a hallucination of Sean's, encouraging him to repeat his sexual exploits with a young babysitter. Apparently has taken on the symbolic role of Sean's inner voice for aggressive behavior. Later, Escobar convinces Christian and Sean to restore his original face. He then breaks out of security while in the clinic, and kills his accomplice to remove a threat to Sean and Christian. It is revealed later in the season that James has been working for him. In the fourth season finale, he is killed by his wife, Gala Gallardo. (deceased)

cell.html: A life coach who routinely manipulates her clients for her own amusement. Is hired by Sean to fix his marriage to Julia only to seduce their son Matt and reveal Christian as Matt's biological father (a result of Julia's one night stand with Christian while she was engaged to Sean and still attending medical school). At the end of season two, Ava was revealed to be transsexual who left her husband/doctor before the final surgery was performed on her; Ava was able to barter with Sean and Christian into performing one last surgery to complete her transformation into womanhood in exchange for her ending her relationship with Matt. Stepmother to Adrian Moore and was married to Dr. Barrett Moore . Also known as Avery Tanner.
cell.text: A life coach who routinely manipulates her clients for her own amusement. Is hired by Sean to fix his marriage to Julia only to seduce their son Matt and reveal Christian as Matt's biological father (a result of Julia's one night stand with Christian while she was engaged to Sean and still attending medical school). At the end of season two, Ava was revealed to be transsexual who left her husband/doctor before the final surgery was performed on her; Ava was able to barter with Sean and Christian into performing one last surgery to complete her transformation into womanhood in exchange for her ending her relationship with Matt. Stepmother to Adrian Moore and was married to Dr. Barrett Moore . Also known as Avery Tanner.

cell.html: The mysterious masked serial rapist known as The Carver, disfigures his victims by cutting a deep slash on either side of their mouths, resembling a smile. Sean McNamara, Christian Troy, Kit McGraw, Kimber Henry and Quentin Costa were the principal characters who fell victim to the Carver attacks. The identity of the Carver was revealed during the Season 3 finale.
cell.text: The mysterious masked serial rapist known as The Carver, disfigures his victims by cutting a deep slash on either side of their mouths, resembling a smile. Sean McNamara, Christian Troy, Kit McGraw, Kimber Henry and Quentin Costa were the principal characters who fell victim to the Carver attacks. The identity of the Carver was revealed during the Season 3 finale.

cell.html: An extortionist that knows Michelle Landau, she apparently seems to have some kind of sexual relationship with her. Michelle Landau worked under her as an escort to pay her way through medical school. James is also the mastermind of the organ theft ring that targeted Liz, and she uses Michelle as a decoy for this purpose. It is revealed that James herself has a boss, one Escobar Gallardo. James later kills herself in front of Michelle, rather than turn Wilber's kidneys over to Escobar. (deceased)

James later kills herself in front of Michelle, rather than turn Wilber's kidneys over to Escobar. (deceased)

cell.html: An 18 year old student that is the daughter of Julia's girlfriend, Olivia Lord. When she is first introduced she tries to seduce Sean McNamara.
cell.text: An 18 year old student that is the daughter of Julia's girlfriend, Olivia Lord. When she is first introduced she tries to seduce Sean McNamara.

cell.html: A talent agent working with Sean due to his role in Hearts & Scalpels. The legitimacy of her practice is brought into questioned by her lack of familiarity with CAA and her false claims of representing various actors, and is later confirmed to be unlicensed. She is shown to be both capable of murder and to have suicidal tendencies.
cell.text: A talent agent working with Sean due to his role in Hearts &amp; Scalpels. The legitimacy of her practice is brought into questioned by her lack of familiarity with CAA and her false claims of representing various actors, and is later confirmed to be unlicensed. She is shown to be both capable of murder and to have suicidal tendencies.

context.text: List of Nip/Tuck characters - Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia
For full character details and histories, see the articles for each character.

Escobar GallardoRobert LaSardo1, 2, 4A ruthless, violent, and somewhat Scarface-esque drug lord from South America who the doctors become entangled with during season one. Has a thing for 1980s music and ultimately blackmailed Sean and Christian into giving him a new face so he could leave the drug business behind and start again. Instead, Sean and Christian gave him the face of another wanted criminal and he was arrested at the airport while attempting to flee the country. Appeared briefly in a dream in the season 2 finale, encouraging Sean to kill the Carver. He also appeared in season 4 as a hallucination of Sean's, encouraging him to repeat his sexual exploits with a young babysitter. Apparently has taken on the symbolic role of Sean's inner voice for aggressive behavior. Later, Escobar convinces Christian and Sean to restore his original face. He then breaks out of security while in the clinic, and kills his accomplice to remove a threat to Sean and Christian. It is revealed later in the season that James has been working for him. In the fourth season finale, he is killed by his wife, Gala Gallardo. (deceased)
Ava MooreFamke Janssen2, 3A life coach who routinely manipulates her clients for her own amusement. Is hired by Sean to fix his marriage to Julia only to seduce their son Matt and reveal Christian as Matt's biological father (a result of Julia's one night stand with Christian while she was engaged to Sean and still attending medical school). At the end of season two, Ava was revealed to be transsexual who left her husband/doctor before the final surgery was performed on her; Ava was able to barter with Sean and Christian into performing one last surgery to complete her transformation into womanhood in exchange for her ending her relationship with Matt. Stepmother to Adrian Moore and was married to Dr. Barrett Moore. Also known as Avery Tanner.
The CarverBruno Campos2, 3The mysterious masked serial rapist known as The Carver, disfigures his victims by cutting a deep slash on either side of their mouths, resembling a smile. Sean McNamara, Christian Troy, Kit McGraw, Kimber Henry and Quentin Costa were the principal characters who fell victim to the Carver attacks. The identity of the Carver was revealed during the Season 3 finale.
JamesJacqueline Bisset4An extortionist that knows Michelle Landau, she apparently seems to have some kind of sexual relationship with her. Michelle Landau worked under her as an escort to pay her way through medical school. James is also the mastermind of the organ theft ring that targeted Liz, and she uses Michelle as a decoy for this purpose. It is revealed that James herself has a boss, one Escobar Gallardo. James later kills herself in front of Michelle, rather than turn Wilber's kidneys over to Escobar. (deceased)
Eden LordAnnaLynne McCord5An 18 year old student that is the daughter of Julia's girlfriend, Olivia Lord. When she is first introduced she tries to seduce Sean McNamara.
Colleen RoseSharon Gless5A talent agent working with Sean due to his role in Hearts & Scalpels. The legitimacy of her practice is brought into questioned by her lack of familiarity with CAA and her false claims of representing various actors, and is later confirmed to be unlicensed. She is shown to be both capable of murder and to have suicidal tendencies.
